thumb.title: Psalm [original song, Vocaloid, Lucas]
thumb.description: Although it sounds religious, it's not about religion. The phrasing may hint at this but the intent is more broad: of seeking solace in known, trusted sources, regardless of their efficacy. OK, that does sound like religion ... but it's not what I had in mind.Tech NotesDrums sounds are Groove Agent with audio samples. Bass sounds from Retrologue, Subtractor & Malstrom (lots of processing), and Full Bucket Tricent emulator; orchestral samples from Reason for violin and clarinet; plus French Horn from Spitfire BBC. More synths from Halion, Arturia CS-80, Thor, Full Bucket Oxid. Vocal sounds from Bloom Vocal Aether and, finally, vocal synths are Vocaloid: Lucas, triple-tracked for added flavour.LyricsDo you sing for your wages?Psalm for the agesAll I want is your wordsClear among those fake sagesSmooth out your ragesPsalm for the agesAll I want is your wordsClear among those fake sagesPenny in the fountainSplashing hope around: ripples fadePutting trust in copper coinsSing for your wages?Psalm of the agesAll I want is your wordsClear among those fake sages
